summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for the team investigating Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618). The emails, spanning from March to December 2019, detail requests for travel to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, Florida, to conduct victim interviews and meetings.

persons.name: Alleyne, Darlene
persons.context: Recipient and CC'd on travel approval request emails, involved in the logistical coordination of travel for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Duncan, Michele
persons.context: CC'd on multiple travel approval request emails, involved in the logistical coordination of travel for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Tyrrell, Edward
persons.context: The official who approves travel requests for the Epstein investigation team. He is addressed as 'Ed' and sends approval emails.

persons.name: Perez, Cynthia
persons.context: CC'd on one travel approval request email (December 11, 2019).

connections.description: Tyrrell is the approving official for travel requests that Alleyne helps coordinate.
Tyrrell is the approving official for travel requests that Duncan is copied on.
Both are administrative/logistics staff copied on the same travel coordination emails for the investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The investigation team requests travel to Los Angeles for an interview (or possibly interviews) on December 16 and/or 17, 2019.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The investigation team requests travel to Los Angeles for an interview on November 14, 2019.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: The investigation team requests travel to West Palm Beach for an interview on November 4, 2019.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The investigation team requests travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview, tentatively scheduled for the week of June 12, 2019.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: The investigation team requests travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims.

events.title: Travel Approval for West Palm Beach Interviews
events.description: Travel is approved for the investigation team to go to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida
events.description: A travel request is made for the Epstein investigation team to travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for two days of meetings and interviews.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing investigative activity in the Jeffrey Epstein case (2018R01618) by the SDNY USAO throughout 2019, months before Epstein's death in August 2019.
The investigation involved traveling to conduct victim interviews in both Los Angeles, California, and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, Florida.
The travel requests frequently mention the need to reserve a conference room at a hotel to conduct interviews, indicating formal interview settings.
The case is formally referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
The email chain shows a standardized administrative process for securing travel approval within the U.S. Attorney's Office for this high-profile investigation.
